Sync="TRUE">gr_turtle_ch_po</ftname></citeinfo>   </citation>   <descript>    <abstract>These data represent the critical habitat for green turtle as designated by Federal Register Vol. 63, No. 46701, September 2, 1998, Rules and Regulations.</abstract>    <purpose>The purpose of these data is to visually represent the critical habitat areas for GIS analysis and display.</purpose>    <langdata Sync="TRUE">en</langdata></descript>   <timeperd>    <timeinfo>     <sngdate>      <caldate>19980902</caldate>      <time>0900</time>     </sngdate>    </timeinfo>    <current>ground condition</current>   </timeperd>   <status>    <progress>Complete</progress>    <update>As needed</update>   </status>   <spdom>    <bounding>     <westbc Sync="TRUE">-65.394620</westbc>     <eastbc Sync="TRUE">-65.193774</rightbc><bottombc Sync="TRUE">18.228993</bottombc><topbc Sync="TRUE">18.398331</topbc></lboundng></spdom>   <keywords>    <theme>     <themekt>None</themekt>     <themekey>Green Sea Turtle</themekey>     <themekey>Chelonia mydas</themekey>     <themekey>Critical Habitat</themekey>     <themekey>Endangered Species</themekey>     <themekey>GIS</themekey>    </theme>    <place>     <placekt>None</placekt>     <placekey>Caribbean</placekey>     <placekey>Puerto Rico</placekey>     <placekey>Culebra Island</placekey>     <placekey>Cayo Norte</placekey>     <placekey>Cayo Ballena</placekey>     <placekey>Cayos Geniqui</placekey>     <placekey>Isla Culebrita</placekey>     <placekey>Arrecife Culebrita</placekey>     <placekey>Cayo de Luis Pena</placekey>     <placekey>Las Hermanas</placekey>     <placekey>El Mono</placekey>     <placekey>Cayo Lobo</placekey>     <placekey>Cayo Lobito</placekey>     <placekey>Cayo Botijuela</placekey>     <placekey>Alcarraza</placekey>     <placekey>Los Gemelos</placekey>     <placekey>Piedra Steven</placekey>    </place>    <stratum>    </stratum>   </keywords>   <accconst>None</accconst>   <useconst>Users be advised that the accuracy of this data set is completely dependent upon the accuracy of the shoreline data used in the creation process. For more details on this process, see the process description. The text description in 63 FR 46701 is always the one, true definition of green turtle critical habitat. These or any other depictions are for information purposes only and shouldn't be relied on for regulatory purposes.</useconst>   <ptcontac>    <cntinfo>     <cntorgp>      <cntorg>NOAA-National Marine Fisheries Service</cntorg>      <cntper>Jennifer Moore</cntper>     </cntorgp>     <cntpos>Natural Resource Specialist</cntpos>     <cntaddr>      <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype>      <address>263 13th Avenue South</address>      <city>St. Petersburg</city>      <state>FL</state>      <postal>33071</postal>      <country>USA</country>     </cntaddr>     <cntvoice>727-824-5312</cntvoice>     <cntfax>727-824-5309</cntfax>     <cntemail>Jennifer.Moore@noaa.gov</cntemail>     <hours>Monday - Friday, 8:00am - 5:00pm</hours>    </cntinfo>   </ptcontac>   <native Sync="TRUE">Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722</native>   <crossref>    <citeinfo>     <title>NOAA Navigation Chart 25653</title>    </citeinfo>   </crossref>   <natvform Sync="TRUE">Shapefile</natvform></idinfo>  <dataqual>   <logic>Not Applicable</logic>   <complete>Complete Pending NMFS PRD Review</complete>   <posacc>    <horizpa>     <qhorizpa>      <horizpae>NOAA Navigation Chart 25653 (Scale= 1:20,000)</horizpae>     </qhorizpa>    </horizpa>   </posacc>   <lineage>    <srcinfo>     <srccite>      <citeinfo>       <origin>NOAA NOS</origin>       <title>NOAA Navigational Chart 25653</title>      </citeinfo>     </srccite>     <typesrc>Raster Nautical Chart</typesrc>     <srccitea>NOAA Navigational Chart 25653</srccitea>    </srcinfo>    <procstep>     <procdesc>Detailed shoreline for Culebra Island from NOAA digital vector chart was appended to add smaller islands, then a 3 nautical mile buffer was generated using ESRI's ArcGIS software.</procdesc>     <srcused>Fish and Wildlife Service (FWS), Department of the Interior and National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Department of Commerce - Endangered and Threatened Wildlife and Plants; Designation of Critical Habitat for the green turtle, [63 FR 46701]</srcused>     <procdate>20050712</procdate>     <proccont>      <cntinfo>       <cntorgp>        <cntorg>NOAA-NMFS</cntorg>        <cntper>Amanda Frick</cntper>       </cntorgp>       <cntpos>GIS Analyst/Contractor</cntpos>       <cntaddr>        <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype>        <address>263 13th Avenue South</address>        <city>St. Petersburg</city>        <state>FL</state>        <postal>33701</postal>        <country>USA</country>       </cntaddr>       <cntvoice>727-824-5312</cntvoice>       <cntfax>727-824-5309</cntfax>       <cntemail>Amanda.Frick@noaa.gov</cntemail>       <hours>Monday - Friday, 8:30am - 5:30pm</hours>      </cntinfo>     </proccont>    </procstep>    <procstep><procdesc>FR 46699 Vol. 63 No 1700 Sept 2, 1998 was reinterpretted and there is a map in the FR which shows that the islands weren't buffered, only Isla de Culebra. Projected base data to WGS-Mercator (units=meters), and buffered to 5.6 km. This buffer does not look like the FR, as it bisects Cayo Lobito. Then the data was reprojected to GCS-WGS84.</procdesc><procdate>03/06</procdate></procstep></lineage>  </dataqual>  <spdoinfo>   <direct Sync="TRUE">Vector</direct>   <ptvctinf>    <sdtsterm
